ResearchProjectDef.label: alpha genetic engineering
ResearchProjectDef.description: This research allows you to recover DNA from alien creatures from Alpha Animals, allowing the creation of powerful hybrids.

ThingDef.label: alpha genePod
ThingDef.description: Alpha Animal genetic material samples are combined and grown in this laboratory.

RecipeDef.label: extract genes from an alpha animal
RecipeDef.description: Extract genetic material from an alpha animal.

RecipeDef.label: bear bug incubator
RecipeDef.description: Fill an incubator with genes from a bear and a bed bug

RecipeDef.label: boomalisk incubator
RecipeDef.description: Fill an incubator with genes from a boomalope and a dunealisk

RecipeDef.label: needlechicken incubator
RecipeDef.description: Fill an incubator with genes from a bird and a needlepost

RecipeDef.label: beetlefleet incubator
RecipeDef.description: Fill an incubator with genes from an insectoid and an aerofleet

RecipeDef.label: groundfallo incubator
RecipeDef.description: Fill an incubator with genes from a muffalo and a groundrunner

RecipeDef.label: meadow lizard incubator
RecipeDef.description: Fill an incubator with genes from a reptile and a meadow ave

RecipeDef.label: animus hare incubator
RecipeDef.description: Fill an incubator with genes from a rodent and an animus vox

RecipeDef.label: nighthrumbo incubator
RecipeDef.description: Fill an incubator with genes from a thrumbo and a nightling

RecipeDef.label: wolf shrimp incubator
RecipeDef.description: Fill an incubator with genes from a canine and a mantis shrimp

ThingDef.label: bear bug incubator
ThingDef.description: This incubator has to be kept at a temperature between 0 and 50 degrees Celsius until the genetically modified organism is ready to hatch. The embryo will develop into a bear-bed bug hybrid

ThingDef.label: boomalisk incubator
ThingDef.description: This incubator has to be kept at a temperature between 0 and 50 degrees Celsius until the genetically modified organism is ready to hatch. The embryo will develop into a boomalope-dunealisk hybrid

ThingDef.label: needlechicken incubator
ThingDef.description: This incubator has to be kept at a temperature between 0 and 50 degrees Celsius until the genetically modified organism is ready to hatch. The embryo will develop into a chicken-Needlepost hybrid

ThingDef.label: beetlefleet incubator
ThingDef.description: This incubator has to be kept at a temperature between 0 and 50 degrees Celsius until the genetically modified organism is ready to hatch. The embryo will develop into a megascarab-aerofleet hybrid

ThingDef.label: groundfallo incubator
ThingDef.description: This incubator has to be kept at a temperature between 0 and 50 degrees Celsius until the genetically modified organism is ready to hatch. The embryo will develop into a muffalo-groundrunner hybrid

ThingDef.label: meadow lizard incubator
ThingDef.description: This incubator has to be kept at a temperature between 0 and 50 degrees Celsius until the genetically modified organism is ready to hatch. The embryo will develop into a lizard-meadow ave hybrid

ThingDef.label: animus hare incubator
ThingDef.description: This incubator has to be kept at a temperature between 0 and 50 degrees Celsius until the genetically modified organism is ready to hatch. The embryo will develop into a hare-animus vox hybrid

ThingDef.label: nighthrumbo incubator
ThingDef.description: This incubator has to be kept at a temperature between 0 and 50 degrees Celsius until the genetically modified organism is ready to hatch. The embryo will develop into a thrumbo-nightling hybrid

ThingDef.label: wolf shrimp incubator
ThingDef.description: This incubator has to be kept at a temperature between 0 and 50 degrees Celsius until the genetically modified organism is ready to hatch. The embryo will develop into a wolf-raptor shrimp hybrid

ThingDef.label: bear bug egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: Unfertilized bear bug egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a beetle egg, it is disgusting either way...

ThingDef.label: bear bug egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: Fertilized bear bug egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a beetle egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a bear bug.

ThingDef.label: boomalisk egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: Unfertilized boomalisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way...

ThingDef.label: boomalisk egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: Fertilized boomalisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a boomalisk.

ThingDef.label: needlechicken egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: An unfertilized needlechicken egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: needlechicken egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized needlechicken egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a needlechick. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: nighthrumbo egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: Fertilized nighthrumbo egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby nighthrumbo. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: meadow lizard egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: Fertilized meadow lizard egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby meadow lizard. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: groundfallo horn
ThingDef.description: This horn could probably be used as an improvised melee weapon. Some merchant might be interested in acquiring it too.

ThingDef.label: alpha genetic material
ThingDef.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from an alpha animal.

ThingDef.label: boomthread
ThingDef.description: This silk is as strong as synthread, but it is also an excellent thermal insulator

ThingDef.label: bear bug
ThingDef.description: This tardigrade-like creature is basically a huge bed bug infused with bear genes. It consumes a large amount of food, but its paralysing attacks combined with its resilience can be very useful in a combat situation.\n\nUseful abilities: Bear bugs produce a powerful neurotoxin that can paralyse their prey, leaving them completely unable to defend themselves.

ThingDef.label: boomalisk
ThingDef.description: The boomalisk is a boomalope / dunealisk hybrid that produces a weird spider silk know as boomthread. This silk is as strong as synthread, but it is also an excellent thermal insulator. Boomalisks also catch their prey with exploding webs, which... sounds dangerous.\n\nUseful abilities: Produces chemfuel, boomthread and attacks with explosive webs.

ThingDef.label: needlechicken
ThingDef.description: This abomination is part chicken, part sentient cactus. If cactus nuggets weren't a thing, they are now. You can think of them as solar-powered egg layers.\n\nUseful abilities: Needlechicken are decent egg layers. They can defend themselves with tiny poison barb attacks, and they almost don't need sustenance (except for a large amount of sunlight).

ThingDef.label: beetlefleet
ThingDef.description: A chitinous, floating, hydrogen-filled monstruosity. The beetlefleet wanders the land bouncing off objects in its path, seeking prey to consume.\n\nUseful abilities: Beetlefleet produce insect jelly, explode on death violently, and reproduce asexually.

ThingDef.label: groundfallo
ThingDef.description: The horned groundfallo is a great pack beast (albeit a bit slow) capable of producing milk and wool, as well as mining for your colony. Compared to a Groundrunner it won't be as efficient on its mining work, but the other characteristics make up for this.\n\nUseful abilities: Produces wool, milk, acts as a pack beast and mines rocks and minerals.

ThingDef.label: meadow lizard
ThingDef.description: The meadow lizard is a beast bred for speed. Even though they are naturally slower than meadow aves, they can be trained to be incredibly fast mounts.\n\nUseful abilities: if properly trained they can be ridden into battle at incredible speeds (this interaction needs the Giddy-Up, combat mounts mod, and it will make the Meadow Lizards move 100% faster when used as mounts). They are also venomous.

ThingDef.label: animus hare
ThingDef.description: The Animus Hare is a small leporid with latent psionic abilities. Quite intelligent for an animal, but not intelligent enough to properly use psionics. It will however quickly bond with human beings and reach with his mind to make happy everyone that treats it well.\n\nUseful abilities: they will often use a psionic nuzzle on colonists, keeping everyone happier. They also breed very fast.

ThingDef.label: nighthrumbo
ThingDef.description: The nighthrumbo is a fearsome predator. Armed with strong jaws and its horn, as well as ranged quill attacks, it will make quick work of any prey it decides to attack. It is also a nocturnal animal, sleeping during the day and being active at night.\n\nUseful abilities: Ranged quill attacks.

ThingDef.label: wolf shrimp
ThingDef.description: A terrifyingly alien creature, the wolf shrimp is keenly intelligent like its wolf forefather, slithering in blinding speed towards its prey.\n\nUseful abilities: Extremely fast regenerative capabilities.
